Step 1: Log on to the Meese
Step 2: Select Revenue Department
Step 3: Select Issue of Small and Marginal Farmer Certificate Service
Step 4: Issue of Small and Marginal Farmer Certificate Request Screen
Step 5: Enter personal details(More info)
Step 6: Enter land details(More info)
Step 7: Enter Informant Details(More info)
Step 8: Uploading the Documents
Step 9: Application Payment
Step 10: Delivery of the Application
More information you need for this form(More info)

Step 1: Appilcation letter
Step 2: Attached court fees stamp
Step 3: 'no objection certificate' from local health officer
Step 4: Original Currency of Renewal deposit amount
Step 5: Original license
Step 6: a copy of the lease agreement for the renewal period, if the place of business is leased
Step 7: Attach Barcode sticker

personal details:
Aadhaar No
Farmer’s Name
Father’s/Husband’s Name
District
Mandal
Village/Ward, Door No/House No
Locality/Land Mark
Pincode
Mobile No
Email ID
Ration Card No

Step 1: Gross annual income (in Rupees) of the beneficiary and his family members
Step 2: A photograph showing his presence on the front side of the residential building (residential structure) for which the occupier has applied for recognition (legitimacy) and allotment of land
Step 3: To state certified copies annexed as evidence in support of his claim of occupancy : K- Regarding the occupancy of the tenant applicant

Step 1: Copy of resolution of Gram Panchayat (Resolution including mention of abatement if there is gauchar)
Step 2: List of eligible claimants for Dharthal plots signed by Talati and Sarpanch
Step 3: List of eligible claimants for Dharthal plots and List signed by Sarpanch
Step 4: Copy of 7/12 of the claimed land
Step 5: stamped with prescribed court fee
Step 6: A bar-code sticker is attached
Step 7: charges reimbursed

Step 1: Lack of entitlement
Step 2: Affidavit of abatement of right
Step 3: Attested copy of death certificate in case of death by a minor
Step 4: Age Basis (Attested Copy of Full Living Certificate/Birth Certificate)

Attested copies of the following proofs have to be enclosed with the application form.
Step 1: 7/12 of the total land held, 8-A and village no. All copies of No. 6.
Step 2: 7/12, 8-A of the acquired land and village no. All copies of No. 6.
Step 3: Attested copy of affected identity card. (if received)
Step 4: Proof of benefit received. E.g. Plot deed, rent agreement.
Step 5: Evidence of benefit claimed earlier, if any.
Step 6: Evidence of benefit claimed earlier and the office has responded.
Step 7: Instances of death of deceased persons in case of inheritance.
Step 8: Copy of ration card.
Step 9: Prescribed affidavit.
step 10: Copies of land revenue receipts up to the date of application, if the plot is received.

Step 1: Attested copy of registration certificate of organization / trust.
Step 2: A copy of the constitution of the institution / trust society.
Step 3: Evidence of financial viability of the Institution Trust Society. (Bank Balance | Deposit etc. Details) (where applicable)
Step 4: Consent resolution of the institution / body regarding management demand for that purpose.
Step 5: Attested copies of village sample no.7/12 of the claimed land.
Step 6: Information outlining the activities carried out by the Institute / Trust. Details of performance during last three years.
Step 7: Audit report of last three years
Step 8: A map of the claimed land and a land use plan (Land Use Plan).
Step 9: Zoning Certificate.
Note: 1. The applicant has to fill the complete details in the application in a clearly legible manner. Also, attested copies of all the proofs as requested must be attached along with the application. Otherwise the application will be returned.

Step 1: Police example of character.(As per Annexure-2/89)
Step 2: Required Scrutiny Fee Rs. 20 Original challan deposited in State Bank of India.
Step 3: 'No Objection Certificate' (as per Annexure-3/89) from Local Body (Nagar Palika | Gram.Pt)
Step 4: Proof of ownership of the place (property card, tax bill, copy of 7/12) | Copy of rental agreement if rental premises.
Step 5: A map with measurements of the location of the space. (in four copies)
